snippet: Ever since Representative George E. Brown Jr., the veteran Democrat who represented California's 42d Congressional District, died last month, Republicans have viewed the Sept. 21 special election that will choose his successor as an opportunity to...
lead_paragraph: Ever since Representative George E. Brown Jr., the veteran Democrat who represented California's 42d Congressional District, died last month, Republicans have viewed the Sept. 21 special election that will choose his successor as an opportunity to strengthen their slim hold on the House. Democrats have seen the contest as a way to weaken that hold. Both sides also think that a win in the 42d, which lies east of Los Angeles in the San Bernardino area and is closely divided between Democrats and Republicans, could help give the victorious party a jump-start heading into next year's House elections.
abstract: Special election to be held in California Sept 21 in 42d Congressional District to choose successor to Repr George E Brown Jr, who died last month (S)ï

headline.main: Off-Year House Race Intrigues Both Parties
